title: Curiosity, Meaning and the Goodness of Being Connects Jordan Peterson, John Vervaeke & Owen Barfield
description:
"Gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder." Chesterton

How does wonder connect to motivation, curiosity, skill development?
Childlike trust in the goodness of reality.

Courage is every virtue at the testing point (C. S. Lewis paraphrase)

Heidegger doesn't have a place for the transcendent. 

Barfield influenced by Coleridge - the noumenal and the phenomenal.

What makes you curious?
"Words are like the DNA of human consciousness." (Barfield)
Form and the expression of that form - consciousness is transmissible from one person to another. Words are like fossils of consciousness. There is so much meaning around a word that the word becomes a token for meaning folded up into each word. Words are keys that unlock certain parts of your brain.

Aspirational - telos - higher point.
Make yourself as much as possible maximally responsible for what is wrong in the world. Balancing justice and mercy.

When you go back in time with language, it becomes more and more metaphorical, putting things together instead of taking things apart.

Being is always saying. To ask about the origin of language is to ask about the origin of origin.

pre-Kant, the working of the mind was not separate from the cosmos.
At Kant, the noumenal and phenomenal divided.

Language is given in a state that connects. Ex: pneuma means spirit, wind and breath. Ancient man was more spiritual.

John McWhorter has a course on the History of Language in Great Courses.

As words become more particular, they lose their richness.
Meaning is always about how things fit together. 

For the infinite to manifest to the finite, there has to be some move.

Early German romantics, finite longing for the infinite.

Poetry for Barfield is the mode of consciously being aware of the inexpressible nature of reality and yet trying to do it with words.
Intensely subjective but uniting it with the objective, drafting an image of what is unrepresentable.

The world is a complex place. We are always hiding our weaknesses.

You can't be forgiven yourself if you are unwilling to forgive another.
